alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued March 14 at 4:11AM CDT until March 16 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, subfreezing temperatures in the 26-30 degree range. For the second Freeze Warning, subfreezing temperatures in the 23-27 degree range. For the Freeze Watch, subfreezing temperatures in the 30-32 degree range are possible. * WHERE...Jackson and DeKalb Counties. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, until 10 AM CDT this morning. For the second Freeze Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 9 AM CDT Wednesday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Wednesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread frost is expected along with the subfreezing temperatures on Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
